definitions: To leave a place or vehicle.
To send something, especially a letter or package.
To start a journey or race.
To remove something from something else.
examples: I need to get off the bus at the next stop.
He was lucky to get off with just a warning.
Did you get off that email to the client?
The racehorses are about to get off.
Can you help me get off this sticker?
The music really gets me off.
